title: Code Review, Security Fix & Compound Documentation
skillsDemonstrated: Path traversal attack understanding (including URL encoding bypass)
Iterative fix process (first fix incomplete, second fix verified)
Programmatic security testing with Node.js http.get
Structured todo tracking with prioritized findings
Git commit workflow with multiple staged commits
openQuestions: npm command not found in Git Bash / Cursor terminal - PATH issue to resolve
Why did background review agents complete but output empty files?
nextObjectives: Session 6: Understanding Your Hooks - read hook code, analyze logs, enhance hooks
Address P2 todos (error boundary, fetch waterfall, data duplication)
Fix npm PATH issue in Git Bash terminal
Hook findings #008, #009, #012, #016 ready for Session 6 curriculum
keyInsights: path.join() is not a security function - it resolves paths but doesn't prevent traversal
Always decode user input (decodeURIComponent) BEFORE validating it - validation on encoded input is security theater
Browsers normalize URLs before sending, hiding path traversal - must test programmatically
First fixes aren't always complete - iterative testing found URL encoding bypass (%2e%2e)
The pre_tool_use.py hook blocked rm commands during the session - proof hooks work in practice
Agent output can be over-engineered - 12 files for 1 bug fix, trimmed to 2 useful ones
